intro: Hedyosmum bonplandianum, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or golden star, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture with a slightly waxy appearance. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns orange when ripe, containing several seeds.
